result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos W Negron

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Amend Judgments of Conviction regarding sentence credit (14CF1292 = 71 days credit, and 15CF76 and 15CF83, 175 days given as sentencing date was July 13, 2015, not July 17, 2015 as stated in stip)
for jail credit, from Atty Paul.
Defendant does not plan on seeking postconviction relief.

Defendant Carlos Negron in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Defendant Carlos Negron in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State has filed amended informations in 14CF1262, 14CF1292 and 15CF76 as well as amended criminal complaint in 14CM1906. Defense acknowledges receipt, waives reading and enters NG plea. The State is in compliance with Ch. 950.
Upon plea to 14CF1292, Cts 1 & 2; state recommends 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES on each count, consec to each other; 15CF76, Cts 1 & 4 of amended information, Cts 2 & 3 are DRI; 14CM1906, Ct 3, balance are DRI; 15CF83, Cts 1 & 3, balance are DRI; on Ct 3, 1 yr IC, 1 yr ES-ss as to cc or cs to 14CF1292 on Ct 1 and Ct 3 in 14CM1906 and 15CF76 - state recommends 3 yrs probation to run consec to other sentences. 14CF1262 will be DRI and 15CF77 will be DRI.  Defense is free to argue.
P-G to all
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Wendy S. Paul in court.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ms. Paul indicates that there was a mistake in scheduling. When deft was out of custody, the case was set for COP. Defendant picked up new charges and defense thought this date was converted to status  Status conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Plea hearing on March 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Carlos W Negron in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Defendant Carlos W Negron in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Carlos W Negron in court with attorney Pamela L. Popken.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
Atty Wendy Paul is not available. 
BTC: Matter is adjourned.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims, CK and GH (person, property, residence or family).   No contact with the co-defendant, MJ. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Carlos W Negron in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Carlos W Negron in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
